responsibilities: Provide technical leadership partnering with other engineers to develop and improve methodology and evolve the technology stack.
Apply modern software development practices, involved in the entire software development lifecycle, building, testing, and delivering high-quality solutions.
Create large scale data processing pipelines to help researchers build and train novel machine learning algorithms.
Develop high performing scalable systems in the context of large online delivery environments.
Work in a collaborative team-oriented environment, sharing information and valuing diverse ideas.
Partner with cross-functional and remote teams.
Deliver timely solutions in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Contribute innovative ideas, create solutions, and be accountable for end-to-end deliveries.
Engage and communicate dynamically with cross-functional partners and team members.
qualifications: Deep understanding of Python software development stacks and ecosystems.
Experience with other programming languages and ecosystems.
Ability to understand, apply, integrate, and deploy Machine Learning capabilities and techniques.
Familiarity with the Python data science stack (Numpy, Scipy, Pandas, Dask, spaCy, NLTK, scikit-learn).
Proficiency in automation, system monitoring, and cloud-native applications.
Familiarity with AWS or Azure (or a related cloud platform).
Proficient in system analysis and design.
Consideration of DevOps and automation as fundamental pillars of work.
Adaptability and ability to thrive in a dynamic environment.
Familiarity with probabilistic models and understanding of mathematical concepts underlying machine learning methods.
analysis: The job responsibilities and skills listed focus on software development, machine learning, and data processing. The responsibilities include creating large-scale data processing pipelines to help researchers build and train novel machine learning algorithms, which suggests involvement with machine learning but does not specifically mention Generative AI or language models. The skills required include a deep understanding of Python, familiarity with the Python data science stack, and the ability to apply machine learning capabilities. However, there is no explicit mention of Generative AI, language models, or specific frameworks or tools commonly associated with them, such as GPT, BERT, or other LLMs. The focus seems to be more on general machine learning and data processing rather than specifically on Generative AI or language models.
